intro: Dracaenopsis australis, commonly known as the New Zealand dracaena, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its upright, slender stems and long, strap-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers in clusters, which are followed by red or orange berries. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and relatively low maintenance requirements. Dracaenopsis australis thrives in well-draining soil and prefers bright, indirect light.
